definition: to accompany/to keep sb company
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
partner/companion/comrade/associate/to accompany

sentences.english: Even if accompanied with dreary day let us smile with teats .
sentences.chinese: 即使陰雨作伴讓我們流淚著歡笑。

sentences.english: We think Astro Soichi would have made a great roommate.
sentences.chinese: 我們覺得屋子裏有宇航員野口聰一作伴一定其樂無窮。

sentences.english: I never would have banished him from her society as long as she desired his.
sentences.chinese: 只要她還要他作伴，我就絕不會把他從她身邊趕走。

sentences.english: I'm thankful for your company when I travelled up to the north.
sentences.chinese: 我去北方時你跟我作伴，我非常感謝。

sentences.english: This made a noise which afforded her company.
sentences.chinese: 那樣她就有一種聲音和她作伴。

sentences.english: Will the night send a howlet or a bat?
sentences.chinese: 黑夜會送來一隻梟或蝙蝠與我作伴嗎？

sentences.english: Rita's husband is away for the week, so I thought I'd go over and keep her company.
sentences.chinese: 瑞達的丈夫出門一個禮拜，我想該過去和她作伴。

sentences.english: Why is there a danger in robot companions?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼和機器人作伴中會有危險？

sentences.english: Romance is a sleepless night with a yellow moon as a companion.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是不眠之夜有黃月作伴。

sentences.english: Those in the Gardens will have maidens for companions.
sentences.chinese: 樂園裏的人會有少女作伴。

definition: to keep sb company/to accompany
to accompany sb/to accompany each other
lone/lonely/loneliness
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
to live alone/to spend time alone (or with a significant other)
to go with sb/to form companionships
partner/companion/comrade/associate/to accompany
lonely/lonesome/(of a place) quiet/silent
to sit face-to-face and drink
lonesome/desolate
to stay together/to rely on one another
to associate with/to keep company with
lit. a lonely body with only a shadow for company/to be all alone (idiom)
to roam far and wide (idiom)/to travel the world
lonely/solitary
